alert.note: Alert for Hooker; Lincoln; Logan; McPherson; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hooker, northeastern Lincoln, western Logan, eastern McPherson and southwestern Thomas Counties through 700 PM CDT/600 PM MDT/... At 621 PM CDT/521 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles north of Tryon to 15 miles north of Hershey. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tryon, Ringgold and Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River. This includes the following highways... Highway 92 between mile markers 198 and 227. Highway 97 between mile markers 17 and 44. Highway 83 between mile markers 127 and 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for southwestern, north central and west central Nebraska.
